Body: I've seen nothing on a trilled "L" sound anywhere. I've tried producing the trilled "L" sound and I can get something that seems similar. Is it possible to trill an "L" and if so are there any languages that use this sound?
Title: Is there use of a trilled "L" sound in any language? Is a trilled "L" even possible?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: I am a researcher at a company that specializes in speech synthesis research. I have a Ph.D. in linguistics from Cornell University, and my areas of specialty are phonology and phonetics. I also have a bachelor's degree in music.

OwnerUser.AboutMe: I enjoy dabbling in languages. I almost know one language, that's English, my mother tongue. I have a constructed language I've been working on with friends for a couple years now, we have it going pretty well. I was homeschooled, that's how I've had time to construct a language. I'm an amateur to linguistics though.
